ygData.messageBody:
>> This is intentional to balance the power of the spells.
>>
>> Brian


First off, the spells are not all that powerful.

For a necromancer at the levels he/she gets the spells yes they can be
powerful for that class. They dont have much health to start with.

As for when shadow knights get these spells, we are looking at a Troll Sk
with almost 300 hitpoints (or more) at lvl 9 so the little life tap isnt
going to effect him much. As he / she gets each additional spell at their
corisponding levels it can help out in getting you that last hit in but
thats about it.

For the so called "power" of the spells the mana requirement is going to
keep them in the back of the book. I thoght the pets could be useless I now
see the life taps are.

If your going to "improve" our class like this atleast give us one more
thing, dont let Harm Touch be resisted. Its a power from the gods after all,
I dont care how powerful you are unless your a god you shouldnt be able to
resist this power.

And if you really want to help this less used class, make some shadow knight
only spells. A paladin can use clerical spells pretty well because a Paladin
is only a Cleric with a sword, now a Shadow Knights spells are from a PURE
CASTER class wich is kind of odd that we use their spells way after they
stop useing them their selves. A little more work is needed with the SK
Class to truly balance them out, your paying customers are speeking out so
you should listen (I see more complaints about SKs then any other class).

Uglugg
Troll SK
